p: Additional risk factors for Type 1 cardiorenal syndrome are related to sepsis-induced pulmonary disease—well recognized to precipitate acute heart failure (due to cardiometabolic stress, i.e. increased cardiac demand in the face of limited cardiac reserve [ 23–27], especially if there is pre-existing HF)—and pre-existing coronary artery disease, additionally predisposed to plaque rupture (due to the systemic inflammatory state).
